newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian shares close above lows in nervous trade.
newsitem.headline: Italian shares close above lows in nervous trade.

text.p: Italian shares closed above the lows on Tuesday in a nervous market with the anxiously awaited March index of the US National Association of Purchasing Managers (NAPM) helping to brake the declines after a key component of the index registered a fall.
The all-share mibtel index dropped 1.61 percent to 11,640 with the blue chip mib30 index falling 1.63 percent to 17,177. Brokers said trading volumes were very thin.
Oil giant ENI and telecom stocks, notably Telecom Italia and state holding company Stet, held up better than most stocks, buoyed by selective buying from foreign fund managers, brokers said.
ENI finished 0.79 percent down at 8,393 lire, with Telecom shedding 0.70 percent to 4,141 lire and Stet falling 0.77 percent to 7,237 lire.
"There are levels below which the market is not prepared to fall," said a broker with a Milan-based finance house. "Inflation is very low and interest rates can't go up by that much," he added.
Fears of further falls on Wall Street and domestic political uncertainties were continuing to weigh heavily on market sentiment.
Among banks, BCI held its ground, shedding 0.45 percent to 3,322 lire with Credito Italiano easing just 0.25 percent to 2,366 lire.
